DataElement.preferredDefinition: Evidence of disease progression on therapy._Types of progression of therapy

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Evidence of disease progression on therapy.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Cancer that continues to grow or spread.

Concepts.definition: A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.

Property.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: SWOG CRF:Southwest Oncology Group Case Report Form

PermissibleValues.value: Unequivocal progression of non-measurable disease in the opinion of the treating investigator
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Non-Measurable Disease Progression Disease or Disorder

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Non-Measurable Disease Progression Disease or Disorder
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not possible to be measured.: The worsening of a disease over time.: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

PermissibleValues.value: >= 20% increase in the sum of appropriate diameters of target measurable lesions over the smallest sum observed, as well as an absolute increase of 0.5cm

A position in relation to its surroundings.: Having no previous example or precedent or parallel; of a kind not seen before.: The outward or visible aspect of a person or thing.: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.
